intro: Nassauvia looseri, commonly known as the desert nassauvia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing shrub with woody stems and small, narrow leaves adapted to conserve water. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow to orange flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its botanical features include a compact growth habit and a high tolerance for drought and poor soil conditions. Nassauvia looseri is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to xeriscaping due to its minimal water requirements.
